alert.note: Alert for Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Warren and northeastern Franklin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Louisburg, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Norlina, Macon, Centerville, Arcola, Ingleside and Afton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
